intro: Odontocarpa, commonly known as the toothed cup, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, cup-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Odontocarpa typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a unique and interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
